chapter.title: Architecture
chapter.para: shows the architecture of this example, consisting of three layers. The data layer contains various MySQL databases storing data sets. The service layer provides web service interfaces to the databases (the GeolocationService uses GeoIP to lookup location from an IP address). The presentation layer contains a web application front-end which can be used by end users to manage staff of a university. All the components in the figure are distributable components (or services) which can deployed on various machines in the network.
